title: Conic Equations and Parameterizations - Part B

content.question: Part B An equation for ellipse <math> <semantics> <mn>2</mn> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIXaaaaa@39B7@</annotation> </semantics> </math> in the <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaamyEaaaa@3AF7@</annotation> </semantics> </math>-plane is given. Ellipse <math> <semantics> <mn>2</mn> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIXaaaaa@39B7@</annotation> </semantics> </math> can also be represented parametrically by the function <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaamyEaaaa@3AF7@</annotation> </semantics> </math> defined by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4778@</annotation> </semantics> </math> for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4092@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Determine expressions for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaaGjcVlaacIcacaWG0bGaaiykaaaa@3DDC@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mtext> </mtext> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaaGjcVlaacIcacaWG0bGaaiykaaaa@3DDC@</annotation> </semantics> </math> such that the path of the ellipse is traced exactly once for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4092@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
